title: BSF pushes 30 more people into Bangladesh
body: The Indian Border Security Force pushed 30 more people into Bangladesh through the Tentulbaria border under Gangni upazila in Meherpur district early Wednesday. They include 16 men, 10 women and 4 children, and all of them are Bangladeshis, according to a press release issued by the Border Guard Bangladesh. The individuals were pushed into Bangladesh through the border near pillar 140/6S, an area under the jurisdiction of Tentulbaria border outpost, the press release said. With the latest push-ins, the number of people, including Rohingyas and Indian nationals, pushed into Bangladesh by India since May 7 has increased to 2,402. The Indian border force has so far pushed at least 223 Rohingyas, including 50 registered with the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees in India, into Bangladesh. The group reportedly entered India through various border points with the help of brokers, was subsequently detained by Indian police, and kept imprisoned in Kolkata before pushing into Bangladesh by the BSF, according to the BGB. Gangni police station officer-in-charge Boni Israel said that the individuals were Bangladeshis and would be handed over to their families after the completion of legal formalities.
